summary:
I am a research-driven individual who likes to engage in analysis, design, and collaborative brainstorming. I am an avid experimenter with new ideas, analogies and simple models of scientific phenomena. My passion is always to make science and technology comprehensible for every human being. For this reason, I have good teaching skills. 
After finishing my PhD in semiconductor device physics, and optoelectronics, I worked in the industry in the field of integrated photonics in silicon nitride platform. I also have an education in the field of analog/digital circuit design. I  like to seek a challenging job that deals with learning new measurement techniques, chip level ASIC design and/or device physics, nanoelectronics, optics and sensors. Currently, I am working in a 4TU collaborative research programme "Plantenna" that aims to develop low cost sensors for plant stress monitoring.
I am a hard working individual who does not refrain from working extra hours to meet an objective.  This also means I like flexibility in working hours when needed. I have B1 certificate in Dutch language. My other interests include Geology, and Astronomy.

profile_positions.description: Prospects of monolithic silicon based optoelectronics in the visible/NIR regime for Lab-on-chip applications; Electroluminescent characterization of poly GaN-on-Si junction diodes.; And Optical Emission Spectroscopy of various plasma used in ALD reactor for GaN.
profile_positions.title: Post Doctoral researcher

profile_positions.description:
Project: Optocoupling in CMOS
My work involves design, modeling,  simulation, and characterization of opto-electronic devices on silicon platform (A-BCD9, CMOS14, TSMC 65 nm), in particular, deepening the understanding and finding ways of optmization of avalanche mode light emitting diodes. Thus, my research and knowledge covers optics, semiconductor device physics , and analog/digital IC technology. These find application for on-chip data transfer in applications that need galvanic isolation between multiple voltage domains.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate
